{{also|范儿}}
==Chinese==
{{zh-forms|s=范儿}}

===Etymology===
A corruption of {{l|zh|份兒|tr=fènr}}, via association with {{l|zh|範|tr=fàn|gloss=example, model}}. The latter was originally a {{w|Peking opera}} jargon, meaning "the skills and tricks that a Peking opera singer has to know in order to deliver a good performance on stage" (e.g. {{l|zh|起範兒}}); also a Beijing colloquialism, meaning "stylish; looking impressive; fantastic". The spread to {{w|Modern Standard Chinese|MSC}} occurred in the 1990s-2000s.
